column1: The Central Seberang Perai District (SPT; Malay: Daerah Seberang Perai Tengah) is a district in the state of Penang
column2: Malaysia. It covers an area of 238 square kilometres
column4: 975 at the 2010 Census . The district is bordered by Perai River which separates North Seberang Perai in the north
column5: Junjong River which separates South Seberang Perai in the south
column6: Kedah state border in the east and South Channel which separates Penang Island. Juru River also flows through the district. The capital of this district is Bukit Mertajam. Other localities that are situated in Central Seberang Perai include Permatang Pauh
column12: Machang Bubok and Permatang Tinggi. The entertainment
column13: eatery and automobile venue of Autocity is also located in this district. Heavy industrial areas cover most parts of Central Seberang Perai.
